intro: Psychotria vaccinioides var. vaccinioides, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking, red-tipped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves contain alkaloids, which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant foliage and unique appearance.
